H0.text: Consumers are the organisms most likely responsible for the biological and chemical changes to a 21‑year‑old tree that is struck by lightning, falls to the forest floor, and dies, undergoing many changes over the next few years.

H1.text: Decomposers are most likely responsible for the biological and chemical changes to the dead 21‑year‑old tree that fell to the forest floor after being struck by lightning.

H2.text: Predators are most likely responsible for the biological and chemical changes that a 21‑year‑old tree undergoes after falling to the forest floor following a lightning strike, over the next few years.

H3.text: Producers are the organisms most likely responsible for the biological and chemical changes to the dead 21‑year‑old tree that falls to the forest floor after being struck by lightning and undergoes many changes over the next few years.

A4.text: lignin is a component of wood, which is relatively resistant to decomposition and can in fact only be decomposed by certain fungi, such as the white-rot fungi.

A5.text: In fallen dead parts of plants (plant litter), this process is largely carried out by saprophagous (detritivorous) soil invertebrate fauna.
